intro: Odina schimperi var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth odina, is a herbaceous plant native to the highland regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels, and it blooms during the dry season. The plant is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in open grasslands and forest margins.
